src:
Sodnikova ljubica je dejala, da je spoznala, da nima jajc zapustiti žene
Sodišče je obsodilo predsednika mariborskega delovnega sodišča Stanka Omerzuja. Pogojna obsodba na šest mesecev zapora in prepoved približevanja oškodovanki.
01 Nov 2019, 16:45 by Aleš Andlovič



Stanko Omerzu je pred branjem sodbe zapustil sodno dvorano.



Sodnik je obsojen, a bo (vsaj za zdaj) še naprej ostal predsednik mariborskega delovnega sodišča.


￼MARIBOR – Štiri ure je zalezovanja obtoženi Stanko Omerzu, predsednik mariborskega delovnega in socialnega sodišča, prepričeval okrajno sodnico Simono Krajnc o svoji nedolžnosti. Toda avtoritativna sodnica, ki je med sojenjem dokazala, da se ne boji niti prekaljenih odvetniških mačkov niti sodnikov z dolgoletnim stažem, se ni dala prepričati. Omerzuja je po dolgotrajnem in napornem sojenju, polnem izmikanj in podtikanj, obsodila na pogojno kazen šestih mesecev zapora.Stanko Omerzu kot pravniški strokovnjak seveda še kako dobro ve, da mu ne bo treba za zapahe, če v naslednjih dveh letih, kolikor traja preizkusna doba, ne bo storil enakega ali istovrstnega kaznivega dejanja. Ker se je tega zavedala tudi sodnica, je še zaostrila kazen, čeprav tožilka Ivanka Slana tega v svojem zaključnem govoru, ni predlagala. Sodniku Omerzuju je izrekla prepoved približevanja žrtvi in mu naložila, da v primeru, da bo prepoved približevanja in komuniciranja z oškodovanko prekršil, končal v zaporu. V praksi to pomeni, da se sodnik Omerzu dve leti ne sme približati niti bloku, v katerem prebiva Slovenjebistričanka, kot tudi ne stavbi, v kateri je zaposlena.
4 ure je Stanko Omerzu prepričeval sodišče o svoji nedolžnosti.
Večina zaključnih besed tožilstva in obrambe je potekala za zaprtimi vrati. Razlog? Podrobnosti iz osebnega življenja obtoženega in oškodovanke. Podobno je bilo z izrekom sodbe. Prvi del je bil javen, nato pa je javnost ponovno morala na hodnik pred sodno dvorano mariborskega okrajnega sodišča. Nadvse zanimivo je tudi, da višji sodnik Stanko Omerzu svoje obsodbe ni slišal v živo. Po svojem zaključnem govoru je namreč zapustil sodno dvorano in ni bil prisoten niti pri izreku sodbe.Da je bil obsojen na pogojno kazen, ga je po telefonu obvestil njegov zagovornik, odvetnik Velimir Cugmas. Obtožnica je sodnika bremenila, da je po vzpostavitvi razmerja oškodovanko zalezoval. Sodnikova ljubica je na sodišču dejala, da je po enem letu prijateljevanja spoznala, da nima jajc zapustiti žene, zato je prekinila razmerje z njim. Potem jo je nenehno klical in ji pisal z različnih telefonskih številk, sporočila pa so bila enkrat ljubeča, drugič grozilna.Pozneje ji je nekdo po telefonu sporočil, da je Omerzu storil samomor in da »naj zdaj živi s to vestjo«. Pred svojimi vhodnimi vrati je trikrat našla vrtnico, enkrat pa obesek z napisom Ljubim te. Enkrat se je nenapovedano sam pojavil pred njenimi vrati. Ker ni več vedela, kaj naj stori, je njuno celotno zasebno korespondenco po elektronski pošti poslala njegovi ženi. Odpisal pa ji je on, in sicer da je s tem storila kaznivo dejanje, hkrati pa jo je spet vabil na kavo. Ker celotni zadevi ni bilo videti ne konca ne kraja, je oškodovanka poklicala policijo.
text:
The judge's mistress said she realized she had no eggs to leave her wife
The court sentenced Maribor Labor Court President Stanko Omerzu. Conditional sentence of six months' imprisonment and prohibition on approaching the injured party.
01 Nov 2019, 15:45 by Aleš Andlovich



Stanko Omerzu left the courtroom before reading the judgment.



The judge has been convicted, but will continue (at least for now) to remain president of the Maribor Labor Court.


￼MARIBOR - For four hours, stalking accused Stanko Omerz, president of the Maribor Labor and Social Court, persuaded County Judge Simon Krajnc of his innocence. But the authoritative judge, who during the trial proved that she was not afraid of either overbearing lawyer cats or judges with many years of service, was not convinced. Omerzuja sentenced her to a suspended sentence of six months' imprisonment after a lengthy and grueling trial, full of evasions and impulses. Of course, Stanko Omerzu knows as a legal practitioner that he will not need to be paroled if, for the next two years, the probationary period , will not commit the same or the same crime. As the judge was also aware of this, she further tightened her sentence, although prosecutor Ivanka Slana did not suggest this in her closing speech. Judge Omerzuu was banned from approaching the victim and ordered him to end up in prison if the ban on approaching and communicating with the injured party breached. In practice, this means that for two years Judge Omerzu must not approach the block in which the Slovenjistrian woman lives, nor the building in which she is employed.
For 4 hours, Stanko Omerzu assured the court of his innocence.
Most of the prosecution and defense closing arguments were held behind closed doors. Reason? Details of the accused's personal life and the injured party. It was similar with the sentencing. The first part was public and then the public again had to enter the hallway in front of the courtroom of the Maribor District Court. It is also interesting that Chief Justice Stanko Omerzu did not hear his sentence live. After his closing speech, he left the courtroom and was not present at the sentencing. To be sentenced to probation, he was informed by phone by his lawyer, lawyer Velimir Cugmas. The indictment charged the judge with stalking the victim after the relationship had been established. The judge's mistress said in court that after one year of friendship, she realized that she had no eggs to leave her wife, so she broke up with him. Then he kept calling her and texting her from different phone numbers, and the messages were affectionate at one time and threatening at other times. She found a rose three times in front of her front door, and once a pendant with the inscription I Love You. One time, he unannounced himself appeared at her door. Since she no longer knew what to do, she sent their entire private correspondence by email to his wife. He wrote to her, saying that she had committed the crime, and at the same time invited her for coffee again. As the whole case did not seem to be the end or the place, the injured party called the police.
